author: sbpabon
title: Technical school for Latin America
description: La gente en América Latina (los desarrolladores también) tienen una comprensión equivocada sobre la tecnología blockchain. Hay demasiados estafadores que venden aceite de serpiente especulativo.

f6_assessments.q0:
Disponer de plataformas de aprendizaje electrónico para que la gente aprenda sobre blockchain es esencial, pero la propuesta carece de información sobre cómo funcionaría esta plataforma.
¿Se desarrollaría desde cero o se utilizaría una plataforma de aprendizaje electrónico ya existente? ¿Habría que pagar por su uso? Si es así, debería haber algunas franjas gratuitas para personas con bajos ingresos.
En segundo lugar, ¿qué contenido (o programa de estudios) se proporcionará aquí? ¿Qué formatos (textos, vídeos, podcasts, conferencias en directo) se utilizarían? Los idiomas en los que se impartirá el contenido también deberían mencionarse en la propuesta para poder evaluar mejor su impacto. Además, ¿cómo interactuaría la comunidad con esta plataforma? ¿Podría la gente enviar o solicitar contenidos? ¿Habría un lugar para los debates? Toda esta información debería estar disponible desde el principio.

Por último, antes de desarrollar la plataforma, hay un paso de aprendizaje pagado en la propuesta. hace que el proyecto tarde mucho más en aportar valor a la comunidad (1 semestre de retraso). Hay otras propuestas para desarrollar plataformas de aprendizaje con resultados más rápidos. Una cosa interesante es desarrollar la plataforma a medida que el proponente aprende en la suya, compartiendo cómo va este proceso y llevando preguntas y discusiones de ida y vuelta entre su curso y y su plataforma de e-learning. Si ya fuera profesor, como se ha descrito, esta interconexión no sería difícil de realizar.
f6_assessments.q1:
Hay una sola persona dedicada ya a este proyecto pero con aparente poco conocimiento sobre lo que pretende enseñar (este conocimiento se desarrollaría en la primera etapa del proyecto). Esto hace que este proyecto sea un poco arriesgado en términos de viabilidad técnica (pensando en la calidad y la poca experiencia del proponente).

Hay un plan/hoja de ruta con fechas (¡esto es bueno!) pero el plazo para completarlo es bastante largo, ya que implica una etapa de aprendizaje antes de comenzar realmente el desarrollo.

El desglose de los costes está indicado, pero podría tener más detalles sobre la parte principal del proyecto: ¿cómo se utilizarán los 5.000 dólares en el desarrollo de la plataforma?
f6_assessments.q2:
En efecto, hay buenos hitos pero no hay KPIs - lo que aparece como KPIs en la propuesta son en realidad hitos, no algo que se pueda medir cuantitativamente. Como verdaderos KPIs, se podrían medir las calificaciones en los cursos (deberían ser altas ya que la comunidad estaría pagando por su curso y para aportar valor a la comunidad), el número de usuarios de la plataforma, el número de contenidos generados, etc. Todo ello con objetivos relacionados con el tiempo.

Como riesgo, el principal sería no conseguir los conocimientos suficientes en el curso para realmente hacer contenidos para esta plataforma.

f6_assessments.q0:
Unfortunately, there is a lack of information in this proposal. 
1) How the platform will actually work? Is it going to be developed from scratch or are you going to use an existing one? If you're going to develop, why are you doing it since there are several others?
2) Since you're creating a 'course', are you planning to monetize it or, since you're thinking in a cultural, caring and developing manner it'll be free? If this have a cost, how much is it going to be?
3) Which country of LATAM you're thinking to reach first? The ones with Spanish language, Portuguese, etc.?
4) the proposal is much more focused in your learning step than developing the community.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no explanation of the methodology that will be adopted in the course, no syllabus, no country/language reference (since LATAM has several languages within it). There is not a detailed explanation of e-learning platform approach. It needs more detail in the timetable. 
The lack of information makes it hard to know if this proposal is feasible besides the scholarship part.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs is not a metric, nothing that can be measured objectively. A KPI would be # positive feedback using the platform, # feedback of syllabus, # people using the platform, etc. The timetable is not detailed as well.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer wants to build a learning platform that will teach the blockchain technology to latin american people. This proposal has effectively identified a problem within the challenge. The problem the proposal is trying to solve is the miseducation of certain people on the blockchain technology. I would suggest to the proposer to be more precise on the subject that will be treated on the platform. The proposer should also be more clear on the type of content that will serve as learning material, whether it will be articles or videos. Apart from that, I think that this proposal can add value to the cardano ecosystem by bringing new users who can help build it. Furthermore, I think that the proposal can scale in future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The idea in this proposal is very interesting. However, there is a lack of information that can compromise its feasibility a little bit. Providing these information can greatly improve the quality of the proposal hence its chance of being funded. The budget should be broken down into identifiable items. In addition to that, the proposer should include a plan for future funds if needed. Furthermore the  proposer should include challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. I have a neutral note on the feasibility of this proposal based on the amount of information provided in that regard.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal includes milestones but it is really vague. The KPIs are not very strong in my opinion but they are included. I think that the proposer should focus on providing more information on what steps are needed to build the platform. Failing to do so will result in a difficult auditability. My note is neutral in the auditability as it needs improvements.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about bringing people closer to blockchain technology. This is a great and meaningful idea. The problem is clear, suitable to the given challenge and clearly explained in detail, and the proposed solution is quite well-prepared [with a specific milestones, budget breakdown, and KPIs,...], showing potential impact on the Cardano ecosystem as a whole. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's impact, I can rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer profile is provided and described enough for understanding, with suitable skill, experiences, and local background [very important for this kind of work] for implementation, with reference/proof (https://github.com/sebpab) for verifying. Moreover, the plan is specific and well-prepared. So, this convinces me of feasibility. However, for a better understanding of feasibility, the risk management should be defined. Therefore, based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's feasibility, I can rate it with a score of 4
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal provides plenty of information. The plan is clearly described. However, for a better understanding, risk management should be defined. Based on the given information, I agree with this proposal's auditability, I can rate it with a score of 4

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal sets out a clear problem which is clearly linked to the challenge criteria and deliberately linked in the sections "How I address the Challenge question?" and "How my proposal impacts the challenge metrics? Thus the desire and reflection of a positive impact in the Latam ecosystem is clearly developed. And allows one to imagine the positive impacts on the Catalyst community as a whole with this goal to  make like a bridge between Cardano technology and the most important problems in the Region. which may not be clearly stated in the KPIs, which rather address technical implementation issues, but which is still understandable, as it has already been stated beforehand.
f6_assessments.q1:
The participant experience and skills are clearly described with links to his profile and videos. The budget is clear and looks realistic, but perhaps could have been a little more detailed regarding the construction of the platform.
The roadmap is not clearly stated even if  appears implicitly through the Milestones and the definition of success after 3, 6 and 12 months. The technical aspects and contextualization are well explained in particular in the objectives of the beginning
 Overall, the project seems realistic, particularly in terms of temporal realization. But the possible risks have not been addressed.
f6_assessments.q2: The informations given emphasizes the benefits of this project for the Latin American ecosystem, its direct relationship with the criteria of the Challenge as well as its positive impact in local terms. Unless I am mistaken, perhaps it would lack more precision especialy with details of how the progress of the project would be transmitted and communicated to the community at large. Even if it´s seems posible to follow it on github. The KIPs and metric values ​​could also have specified the quantitative objectives in terms of educated people, to give more idea on the number of people concerned, which would have specified the impact at the local level of this project. But a time horizon is given with an Expected public launch date of the platform in August 01, 2022, which is a good point.

f6_assessments.q0: This is an amazing education initiative and effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's GitHub shows they have begun some level of plutus pioneer training, as well as other repos in various languages. The plan included has KPI's, milestones, roadmap and a budget.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has described their plan to build a technical learning platform for blockchain enthusiasts in LatAm in solid detail within the proposal. The info provided is sufficient to audit the progress of the proposal.

solution: Descarta por completo el argumento de venta de blockchain para acercar a la gente a la tecnología. La solución no es convencer, es enseñar.
